channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The global empathy crisis that confronts us this Christmas
item.description: Empathy levels diminished 14% across the U.S. after the pandemic, with the steepest drop among millennials, according to a United Way survey.

item.title: Goldman Sachs expects layoffs to keep rising—and says investors are punishing the stocks of companies that slash staff
item.description: Analysts ran the numbers and found a surprising change in how investors are reacting to layoff announcements.

item.title: Telluride resort owner rips into ski patrol union after strikes shuts down slopes on Christmas
item.description: The Telluride Professional Ski Patrol Association voted to strike Saturday after contract negotiations since June failed to yield an agreement on pay.

item.title: Drummer cancels Christmas Eve ‘Jazz Jams’ at Kennedy Center after name change, ending 20-year tradition
item.description: “When I saw the name change on the Kennedy Center website and then hours later on the building, I chose to cancel our concert,” Chuck Redd told the AP...

item.title: California farming mogul in bitter divorce proceedings arrested on suspicion of murdering his wife
item.description: Michael Abatti has grown onions, broccoli and cantaloupes and served on the board of the powerful Imperial Irrigation District from 2006 to 2010.

item.title: With 20 minutes left to trade, the S&P 500 looks to close at an all-time high
S&P 500 closes at fresh record high in holiday-shortened session
S&P 500 hits record high on Christmas Eve for first time in more than a decade
Investors' real gift from Wall Street comes the day after Christmas
Move over Mariah: How Michael Bublé is becoming the king of Christmas music
